metadata.titleEn: RNA-seq data of human umbilical vein endothelial cell samples
metadata.description:
1) Data content: this data is the placenta umbilical cord endothelial cells (HUVEC) transcriptome data of high altitude Tibetan and lowland Han population generated during the implementation of the project, including the RNA-seq data of 3 high altitude Tibetan HUVEC and 3 lowland Han placenta HUVEC. Each RNA-seq data is 6G sequencing depth, which can be used to study the effect of high altitude Tibetan population and lowland Han population for gene expression patterns at hypoxic environment.
2) Data source and processing method: own data, the pair end 150bp sequencing method using Illumina x-ten sequencing platform.
3) Data quality: 6G data depth, q30 > 90%.
4) Results and prospects of data application: the data will be used to validate the gene expression pattern of high altitude hypoxia adaptation gene to hypoxia environment at the cell level.
metadata.instructions: A represents Tibetan adaptive cell line; W represents Han wild type cell line.

authorList.unitEn: Kunming Institute of Zoology, Chinese Academy of Sciences

literatureList.titleEn: Down-regulation of EPAS1 transcription and genetic adaptation of Tibetans to high-altitude hypoxia

(2017). Down-regulation of EPAS1 transcription and genetic adaptation of Tibetans to high-altitude hypoxia. Mol Biol Evol 34, 818-830.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the specific characteristics of single-cell transcriptome sequencing data collected from placental samples of high-altitude Tibetan and lowland Han populations?
Feature Specification.Answer: RNA-seq, umbilical endothelial cells, 3 high-altitude Tibetan samples, 3 lowland Han samples, sequencing depth of 6G

Causal Antecedent.Question: What are the underlying reasons that influence the choice of sequencing platform and library construction methods in generating single-cell transcriptome data for placental samples from different populations?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: The choice of the Illumina X-ten sequencing platform and the Pair-end 150bp library construction method is influenced by the need for high sequencing depth and accuracy, as evidenced by the achievement of 6G data volume with over 90% Q30 quality. These factors are crucial for accurately capturing gene expression differences between high-altitude Tibetan and lowland Han populations in hypoxic environments.

Causal Consequence.Question: What are the potential impacts on understanding gene expression differences when using a data collection method involving Illumina X-ten sequencing with a sequencing depth of 6G and Q30>90%?
Causal Consequence.Answer: Using the Illumina X-ten sequencing platform with a sequencing depth of 6G and Q30>90% ensures high-quality data, which can accurately capture gene expression differences between high-altitude Tibetan and low-altitude Han populations, thus enhancing understanding of genetic adaptations to hypoxic environments.

Goal Orientation.Question: What are the primary objectives behind collecting single-cell transcriptome sequencing data from placental samples of high-altitude Tibetan and lowland Han populations?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The primary objectives are to investigate the gene expression differences in response to the hypoxic environment between high-altitude Tibetan and lowland Han populations, and to validate hypoxia adaptation genes at the cellular level.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What procedures are necessary to ensure high-quality data collection and sequencing for single-cell transcriptomics in human placental samples from different populations?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The data collection method involves utilizing the Illumina X-ten sequencing platform with a Pair-end 150bp library construction and sequencing approach. This method ensures data quality, with a sequencing depth of 6G and Q30>90%, suitable for analyzing gene expression differences under hypoxic environments.

Enablement.Question: What sequencing technology advancements enable the collection of detailed single-cell RNA-seq data from human placental samples in high-altitude and low-altitude populations?
Enablement.Answer: The use of the Illumina X-ten sequencing platform with Pair-end 150bp library construction sequencing method enables the collection of detailed single-cell RNA-seq data from human placental samples, allowing for in-depth analysis of gene expression differences between high-altitude Tibetan and low-altitude Han populations.
